snippet.title: C64 Longplay: RMS Titanic (RE-UPLOAD)
snippet.description:
a.k.a. "Titanic - The Recovery Mission" as released in the U.S. 

My original video was split into three parts, and was 4 and a half hours long (!). For this one, I merged the footage in Shotcut editor and re-recorded it at a higher speed. This also has added on-screen guides and maps. 

I would recommend setting the YouTube Speed to 0.75 to make it easier to follow. 

In the process of re-recording I lost the audio track, though this hardly matters as the original game only had a few bleeps outside of the two tunes on the options screens. 

At 30:08 I stopped adding the maps and guides as my editing program couldn't handle it at this point, so you may want to go back and look at the earlier parts on the timeline. ORIGINAL SOLUTION SOURCE: http://tin.at/c64/rms_titanic/rms_titanic.sol.pdf

Feel free to comment if you think anything could be improved.

For first-timers a full description of the game can be found here: https://www.c64-wiki.com/wiki/R.M.S._Titanic

Published: 1986, Electric Dreams Software
Musician: Steven Green
Graphicians: Geoff Quilley, Jonathan Hare & Stephen Robertson
Programmers: Richard Yapp, Darrell Etherington & Steven Green
